release_notes.en-US:
Added icons to Firefox Quantum, Signature Switch
extensions.cutebuttons.toolbarbutton defaults to true
Stopped removing perfs branch on addon uninstall
Added a couple more icons to Download Manager (S3)
Cleaned up TB code

description.en-US: http://addons.palemoon.org/addon/cutebuttons/ For now you can manually install my CSS files with UserChrome/UserContent (see the github page). You could also install dev version of Firefox and set extensions.legacy.enabled to true. Until Mozilla adds an API or other method to globally apply CSS to Firefox, there isn't anything I can do to build a Firefox Quantum version. CuteButtons works fine on Pale Moon, and I'll keep it updated on here till Mozilla decides no more XUL add-ons on AMO. After that keep an eye on the github page or https://addons.palemoon.org/ Please read the Developer Comments before posting a review. P.S. if you have icons missing/wrong, or you want an extension added then please send me an email. For some reason this is my only addon that doesn't display the version notes below, so: https://choggi.org/misc/CuteButtonsCrystalSVG/change.log Inspired by/uses code & icon set from CuteMenus - Crystal SVG (you don't need to have CuteMenus installed). Adds icons to these extensions, and generic icons to others: (this list hasn't been updated for ages) Adblock Filterset.G Updater, Adblock Plus, AI Roboform, Autocopy, Autofill Forms Back to Top, Bookmark DD, British English Dictionary Calc, Cache Status. Cache View, CacheViewer, Chatzilla, Chrome List, CLE, Clippings, CookieSafe, CustomizeGoogle Dictionarysearch, Download Statusbar, DownThemAll! Easy DragToGo, Enigmail, Explore Chrome FasterFox, Favicon Picker 2, FEBE, Fetch Text URL, Firebug, FireFTP, Fission, FlashGot, Forecastfox, FormFiller, FoxMarks, Foxy Proxy, Foxytunes Gmail Manager, Gmail Notifier, Googlebar Lite, GreaseMonkey, GSpace HTML Validator IE Tab, IEView Lite JSView keyconfig Lightning, LinkVisitor, Live HTTP Headers, LiveClick Menu Editor, MinimizeToTray, MR Tech Toolkit (Local Install), Multiple Tab Handler NoScript, NoSquint, Nostalgy Objection, ObPwd, OmniSidebar, Organize Search Engines, Organize Status Bar PageShortcuts, Password Hasher, Password Exporter, PasswordMaker, PDF Download, Personal Menu, Perspectives, Public Fox QuickNote RDFViewer, Redirect Remover, Remove it Permanently, RSS Ticker Sage, Save Link in Folder, Secure Login, Session Manager, Smart Link, SmoothWheel, SQLite Manager, Show Picture, Splash!, Split Browser, StumbleUpon, Stylish, Stylish-Custom, StyleSheet Chooser Plus Tab Mix Plus, TargetKiller, Titlebar Tweaks, Tweak Network Update Notifier, Update Scanner, Unplug View Cookies WeatherBug, Wizz RSS Xmarks LouCypher's inspectWindow.uc.js/inspectChrome.uc.js

developer_comments.en-US: This tries to add icons to every menu and button, if you have a slower computer you may wish to try a smaller icon extension. This extension sticks icons all over firefox, you should expect your memory usage to increase FF 31.0 Win7 x64 16GB (empty profile): with CB: Private Bytes:137MB Working Set:151MB without CB: Private Bytes:123MB Working Set:139MB Palemoon 25.2.1 x64 (and my profile; 35 addons) with CB: Private Bytes:259MB Working Set:232MB without CB: Private Bytes:241MB Working Set:212MB CuteButtons has a knack for messing with configuration options for other extensions (try disabling icons in cutebuttons config, and please let me know) For some languages I haven't added translations, so the statusbar shows a red X icon (you can hide the statusbar icons in the options or add them yourself and send the translated file to me) You can use the .css files on older unsupported versions of firefox with UserChrome.css. You will also need a mosaic.png, place it in the same place as UserChrome.css. http://kb.mozillazine.org/index.php?title=UserChrome.css You'll need a zip program to open the .xpi Missing menu icons under linux: http://ubuntuhandbook.org/index.php/2013/11/ubuntu-unity-menu-button-have-icons/ If you've made an alternate mosaic.png and want it to be included then send it to CuteButtonsCrystalSVG@choggi.org You'll either need to edit one of the mosaic*.png files with the icons you like, then email it to me, or send me the edited XCF file. This is the file I use to make the mosaic*.png files, you'll need a copy of gimp https://choggi.org/misc/CuteButtonsCrystalSVG/Mosaic/compressed.7z

summary.en-US: Adds icons to buttons and/or menus.
